name: Orford's Sanda House B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: May be B&B is not our type, however I wanted to give it a try and Orford's Sanda house seemed to be a good one.
reviews.title: A bit disappointed by our 1st B&B experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found it nice to have a leisure room where all guests could come, read a book, play games, listen to music. The breakfast next to the fireplace was fun as well, despite we were expecting a real Australian breakfast, but that's not a big deal.
reviews.title: Sometimes 'old' just isn't enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The thing is that you don't really feel in a private space except when you're locked in your room: Like I read in another comment, you have to cross a small room where your fridge is, to go in your bathroom. But the owners can cross that room, so that's a weird sensation. Like you're in someone else place. But that's may be because I'm not used to B&B.
reviews.title: Bed and Breakfast and maybe a couple of ghosts.

description: 1840 heritage listed stone house. Traditional bed & breakfast set in cottage garden with orchard and soppy dog. Furnished with owners collection of antiques. Tariff includes hearty continental breakfast,(homemade bread and jams). Walk to beaches and pizza restaurant. Very peaceful. Use us as a base for day trips to Port Arthur, Freycinet and Maria Island. Sit on the front verandah and watch birds. All modern comforts, each room has own bathroom. Not self contained.
